When a user creates a new single player game, they must enter their name, choose an icon from a predetermined list and set the score limit for winning a hand of Mahjong.
The list of un-started games that the MultiMahjongClient fetches from the MultiMahjongServer will be displayed in such a way that users can see the following information about each game.

If the configurations of: the current discard, the tiles in a user's hand, and the player whose turn it is, would allow the user to Chow/Pung/Kong/Mahjong under the Chinese rules of Mahjong, the MultiMahjongClient will inform the user that they can do so.

The Clarus system shall be able to receive roadway weather measurements derived from VII data.
The Clarus system shall accept weather hazard reports containing the hazard type, location, and timeframe.
The Clarus system shall collect pavement-related observations.
The Clarus system shall accept environmental data from service patrol vehicles.
The Clarus system shall provide environmental data quality flags.

The Clarus system shall be able to base its quality control process on values from multiple observations.
The Clarus system shall minimize the time for data dissemination.
The Clarus system shall enable system administrators to manage security groups.
The Clarus system data definitions shall be consistent with the ITE TM 1.03 standard, Functional Level Traffic Management Data Dictionary (TMDD).
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate surface metadata.
The Clarus system shall be able to acquire, process, and disseminate environmental data from across North America.

The Clarus system shall enable environmental data queries by timestamp.
The Clarus system shall manage system user privileges according to the Clarus data sharing agreements.
The Clarus system shall be able to operate on redundant hardware.
The Clarus system shall disseminate data using standard Internet protocols.
The Clarus system shall be able to receive all reported environmental data during a fifteen minute time interval.
The Clarus system shall be able to support six hundred concurrent users.
The Clarus program shall provide an environment that has uninterruptible power for the Clarus system.
The Clarus program shall provide a trained support staff.
The Clarus program standards shall accommodate contributions of new sensor technologies to the Clarus system.
